content: What is your honest review of the Demo account?Do you think that should spend so much time trading on a demo account? I believe that in demo trading, there are no real consequences for losing "money". If you notice, the pain is different than the one felt when you actually experience a loss on a live account. Demo trading simply helps the newbie get acquainted with the trading platform, and it should only be for a few weeks. Compared to  live trading, demo trading lacks the ability to mental and emotional resilience. For me, the real trading education starts where demo trading ends. What do you think?1. admiralmarkets.sc/education/articles/forex-basics/...f-forex-demo-account2. http://tradethatswing.com/when-to-switch-from-demo-to-liv...rading-real-capital/

comments.author: alik111
comments.body: I think every new users should try demo trading first as it helps user to be an experienced trader. I also tried demo trading and learned a lot. It really helps when you do future trading even if can generate trading strategies with demo accounts.

comments.body: Demo account is rubbish in my opinion, although it is not a waste of time for some people.Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 30, 2023, 08:12:33 PMI believe that in demo trading, there are no real consequences for losing "money". It is not only that there is not emotion in demo account like real account. In real account, you can trade with just $10 on many trading platform. There are even many trading platforms that you can trade less than $10, even with $1. So why the need for demo account? It is totally not useful for me and I did not use itnwhen I was learning how to trade.When I started to trade futures, my first position was opened with just $0.25. see how low in amount of dollar it is. So why demo account when you can go that low in the amount of money that you can use to open a position to study the how trading works.

comments.author: goaldigger
comments.body: Demo trading is like trying the platform itself, familiarizing about it though you can do the actual trading but there’s no risk on that and your emotion might not be present by that time but still using a demo trading at first is a big help. Trading is a long journey, you should not think about making money instantly, because in trading anything can happen and losing are more possible if you do trade without having your own analysis. If you want to learn the process and feel the hype or fud, better start trading small and you’ll learn more from this.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Anybody who used demo trading accounts as away of learning day to day live trading is lying to themselves. The biggest component of trading is emotions, without real money, there are no "real" trading emotionsDemo accounts are only good for newbies if they are trying to learn how to make orders, create stop losses etc. Besides, most demo trading platforms are illiquid and do not depict the actual trading environment. A good example are the Binance and bybit demo trading platforms. They suck in every bit, especially if you are an experienced trader.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Using demo account is like smoking a nicotineless cigarette.And as others have said, it is only useful for learning how to use the platform (e.g., buying, selling, SL, placing  order, etc..), and not something that will teach you proper trading management as it is lacking some kind of consequences when a trade goes south.The only difference between a real and demo account is the mental aspect of trading...and that's self explanatory.

comments.author: Tony116
comments.body: I agree, demo trading should only be used for the first few weeks to get used to the interface and how to place orders. Do not use it for too long and consider it as a place where we will have experience for actual trade later. There is a huge difference when using a demo account and a real account. I bet that even if you win on a demo account, you will soon lose on a real account. Psychology and emotions will be completely different. As for me, I never use and encourage anyone to use a demo account, it will very easily lead us to have wrong habits and actions when using a real account.

comments.body: Quote from: Davidvictorson on March 30, 2023, 08:12:33 PMFor me, the real trading education starts where demo trading ends. comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: The demo account is created for the learning of people who want to deepen their trading lessons. Using a demo account, they can learn to analyze by applying lots of analyses and strategies. And if you don't understand more about trading and you lose, you don't lose your money but it's demo money provided for you.So you don't need to fear losing money trading using a demo account. And when you understand trading and have mastered how to analyze the market well, you can use a real account to apply what you have learned.
